10:48 <+mflorea> ok, let me explain  
10:53 <+mflorea> I have an XDOM tree and I want to cache it. This XDOM contains a macro that calls SkinExtension#use() when it is executed. If I cache the XDOM after the macro transformations are performed then next time I use the XDOM from the case macros won't be re-executed (because they have been executed) and thus the SkinExtension#use is not called. If I cache the XDOM before the macro transformations are performed then I need to clone the XDOM each time I render (+macr  
10:55 <+jvelociter> mflorea: you use the {{cache}} macro ?  
10:56 <+mflorea> jvelociter: no, it's a cache internal to the office viewer module  
10:56 <vmassol1> mflorea: in XwikiDcoument we cache the XDOM before the tx  
10:56 <+mflorea> when you view and office attachment, its XDOM is cached so next time you view it is displayed quicker  
10:57 <vmassol1> I do'nt think caching after tx is exeecuted is good in any use case (it would mean static cachnig)  
10:57 <+mflorea> vmassol1: so you are caching a clone, because tx are execute on the XDOM, and can affect the cached XDOM  
10:58 <vmassol1> actually in xwikidocument we don't use it for rendering  
10:59 <vmassol1> we only cache it for other operations involved in traversing the xdom (not modifying it)  
10:59 <vmassol1> (AFAIR)  
10:59 <vmassol1> (we do have an issue btw with translations since we only cache the default content not translations but that's another matter)  
11:00 <+mflorea> so is there another way to protect the cached XDOM from being affecting by the tx other than cloning it before executing the tx?
